lines.text: You know, if my insurance company finds out that I'm riding with you, they're gonna cancel my policy.
I just put my foot in the wrong place.
Oh, you did. Well, if you do it again, I'll put my foot in the right place!
I am certainly am glad to meet someone that's interested in flowers. I'm a student of botany also. Bledsoe's my name.
Up to now, I've lead a decent, respectable life. But, I'm beginning to weaken.
Well, now that you've got it out, what are you going to do with it?
I don't know? Put it back, I guess.
Loosen that nut over there.
There's one nut loose around here now and that's enut.
Here, useless, exert yourself.
Take that bird to the fingerprint room. Check his record.
And so, chop suey to the left of him - laundries to the right of him - into the midst of Chinatown strode Harold Bledsoe.

[Walks in after a brawl in a Chinese restaurant]
What are you trying to do here, start a revolution?
Just a moment, I came here to get your gun.
My gun?
Yes, there it is.
[Takes it out of the pocket of a knocked out Chinese patron]
Well, that is my gun.
You see, I chased him in here. But, they all looked alike.
Chief, you sure know your onions!
Put 'er there, Bledsoe. You sure know your petunias!
Well, everything turned out great, didn't it?

[Last lines]
This must be heaven.
It certainly is.
